Articles.Content:
:snip:

BTW, the space suit which Bullock uses it the Strizh, right? It's not EVA rated.

I haven't seen Gravity yet but I'd wager it's an Orlan space suit, possibly the Haiying variation used by China. I can't quite make out the lettering, but the Orlan suits are available on the ISS and I know they visit a Chinese station at one point in the movie.

EDIT: According to some quick research, it's a mix of Sokol and Strizh suits, neither of which are EVA-rated curiously.

Edited November 11, 2013 by Lyinginbedmon

BTW, the space suit which Bullock uses it the Strizh, right? It's not EVA rated.

Nope, it's a "hybrid" of Sokol, Orlan and Strizh. I think only the helmet looks like the Sokol. They're meant to be a pressurized bubble basically. More like ascend/descend suits. Not really for EVA.

Are there any templates for suit textures?

Edited November 11, 2013 by AlbertoKermov

To the person who created this pack, Kerbin seems to have some bugs: it either crashes the game during the loading screen or somes up with a lot of graphical errors. Any chance you could release a compressed version or something? I really want a cloudy Kerbin in my game.

Speak for yourself, I'm still stuck waiting for that guy's super cool Eve texture.

Sorry, universe replacer started crashing my computer and I realized that as pretty as it is, I really want to be able to play the game itself.

I kept kerbin though. 8k... clouds... city lights... mmm

So, about Eve. I tried it and realized that things get warped really weird when they are wrapped around a sphere. So my new texture has a different cloud map. Might not look as good flat, but I think it should do wonders on the planet itself.

There's a big and a small PNG. I don't know what the hell you people want.

http://www.solidfiles.com/d/eaf67128b9/

The green button starts the download, right? I don't speak French.

Those look awesome, by the way.

The one starting the download is "TÃƒÂ©lÃƒÂ©chargement Gratuit"

I'll put a screenshot of it on my post

Thanks.

Thanks in advance.
What's the difference between the 2 files? What does SRC stand for?

What's the difference between the 2 files? What does SRC stand for?

Source code.

The difference between the files is that 99% of us (you included) don't care about the source code and only need the main file.

Source code.

The difference between the files is that 99% of us (you included) don't care about the source code and only need the main file.

Thanks. So the basic 'if you don't know what it is, you don't use it'

I really appreciate that. Let me know where and when I can download it!

I've been wondering if there's a stock KSP skybox but high res. I'm not sure how someone can manage to make that, but is like that very much. The stock one is very blurry on 1440p but I don't want to change it too much either.

I prefer my Eve completely clouded ÃƒÂ  la Venus instead of Earth, but the terrain itself is impeccable. Eve always gave off this kind of (liquid) metallic vibe and your terrain pulls that off better than the original. Great work!

I prefer my Eve completely clouded ÃƒÂ  la Venus instead of Earth, but the terrain itself is impeccable. Eve always gave off this kind of (liquid) metallic vibe and your terrain pulls that off better than the original. Great work!

I agree with you, however I like seeing where I'm going to land. Thanks for the kind comments.
Is it possible to only get the suits, but not everything else?

Is it possible to only get the suits, but not everything else?

Absolutely, just install only the suits you want and leave everything else alone.
Sorry for all the questions, but how do you get the textures, does it come with a default, or do you download them seperately? So far i only downloaded the universe replacer on the first page.

Sorry for all the questions, but how do you get the textures, does it come with a default, or do you download them seperately? So far i only downloaded the universe replacer on the first page.

You download them separately. There's a list of texture packs in the OP, as well as several others scattered across this thread.
